tit.e: The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road
The 53 Stations of the Tokaido Road
The 53 Stations of the Tokaido Road

sen.j: 東海道五十三次（とうかいどうごじゅうさんつぎ）
sen.e: The fifty-three stations of the Tokaido Road
The 53 stations of the Tokaido Road
The 53 stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido gojusan tsugi) can mean:
sen.cmt: (Tokaido gojusan tsugi)追加「東海道」と同様、「東海道五十三次」は以下の３つを意味するという内容なので、そのように補いました。

sen.j: 江戸時代に江戸（日本橋 (東京都中央区)）と京都（三条大橋）を結んだ東海道の53の宿場。
sen.e: The 53 posting stations on Tokaido Road which connected Edo (Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) and Kyoto (Sanjo Ohashi Bridge) in Edo Period.
sen.cmt: Yahoo 辞書、英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The 53 posting stations on the Tokaido Road, which connected Edo (Nihonbashi (Chuo ward, Tokyo) and Kyoto (Sanjo Ohashi Bridge) during the Edo period.
The 53 posting stations on the Tokaido Road, which connected Edo (Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) and Kyoto (Sanjo Ohashi Bridge) during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: ward→Ward 他ファイルと統一NCの見直しで原文から乖離。元のtrans2に戻すThe Tokaido Road, with its 53 posting stations, connected Edo (Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) and Kyoto (Sanjo Ohashi Bridge) during the Edo period.

sen.j: 本項で説明する。
sen.e: To be explained in this section.
To be explained in this section.
To be explained in this section.

sen.j: 東海道の53の宿場（或いは起点終点を含めた55）を描いた歌川広重作の浮世絵。
sen.e: Ukiyoe painted by Hiroshige UTAGAWA of 53 posting stations (or 55 including the starting/ending stations).
The ukiyoe works were painted by Hiroshige UTAGAWA of 53 posting stations (or 55, including the starting/ending stations).
The ukiyoe works painted by Hiroshige UTAGAWA depicted 53 posting stations (or 55, including the starting/ending stations).
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳しなおしました。

sen.j: サンソフトから発売されたファミリーコンピュータ用ゲームソフト。
sen.e: A game software for family computers released by Sunsoft.
Game software for family computers released by Sunsoft
Game software for family computers released by Sunsoft

sen.j: →東海道五十三次 (ゲーム)
sen.e: The fifty-three stations of the Tokaido Road (game
The 53 stations of the Tokaido Road (a game)
The 53 stations of the Tokaido Road (a game)

sen.j: 東海道五十三次（とうかいどうごじゅうさんつぎ）は、江戸時代に整備された五畿七道のうち、東海道を通る幹線道路（街道）「東海道」にある53の宿場を指す。
sen.e: The fifty-three stations of the Tokaido Road, refers to 53 stations in 'Tokaido Road', the major road running through Tokaido region, and is among Goki-Shichido (五畿七道),
"The 53 stations of the Tokaido Road" refers to 53 stations in 'Tokaido Road,' the major road running through the Tokaido region, and is among Goki-Shichido (五畿七道).
The "53 stations" of the Tokaido Road refers to 53 stations in 'Tokaido Road,' which is the major road running through the Tokaido region and is among five provinces and seven circuits(Gokishichido).
sen.cmt: 原文に『』がない" "削除五畿七道を英訳。

sen.j: この53の宿場はそれぞれ風光明媚な場所や有名な名所旧跡に設けられている場合も多く、当時浮世絵や和歌・俳句の題材にしばしば取り上げられた。
sen.e: Many of such 53 stations are each established in a place where the scenery is beautiful, or in famous historic spots, and were often used as subjects of ukiyoe or waka/haiku.
sen.cmt: 英辞郎 on the WEB、Yahoo辞書
sen.e: Many of the 53 stations are established in places where the scenery is beautiful, or in famous historic spots, and often served as the subjects of ukiyoe or waka/haiku.
Many of the 53 stations are established in places where the scenery is beautiful, or in famous historic spots, and often served as the subjects of ukiyoe or waka/haiku.

sen.j: なお五十三次と称す場合は京都までの場合であり、さらに大阪までを表す場合は五十七次となる。
sen.e: Furthermore, when it is called fifty-three stations, it refers to the road up to Kyoto, and when referring to the road up to Osaka, it is called fifty-seven stations.
Furthermore, when it is called "53 stations" it refers to the road up to Kyoto, and when referring to the road up to Osaka the term "57 stations" is used.
Furthermore, when it is called 53 stations it refers to the road up to Kyoto, but when referring to the road up to Osaka the term 57 stations is used.

sen.j: 以下、令制国名ごとに分類する。
sen.e: From here onwards, we will categorize by each Province.
From here onward we will categorize them according to their respective provinces.
From here onward we will categorize them according to their respective provinces.

sen.j: 数は品川宿からの通し番号である。
sen.e: Serial number is used starting from Shinagawa-juku Station.
Serial numbers are used, starting at Shinagawa-juku Station.
Serial numbers are used, starting at Shinagawa-juku Station.

sen.j: ※平成の大合併で消滅した自治体に関しては旧自治体名もあわせて表記する。
sen.e: *With respect to local governments which were extinguished as the result of the great Heisei merger, names of former local governments are also listed.
*With respect to the local governments that became defunct as a result of the great Heisei merger, the names of former local governments are also listed.
*With respect to the local governments that became defunct as a result of the great Heisei merger, the names of former local governments are also listed.

tit.e: The reason why the fifty-three stations were established
The reason the 53 stations were established
The reason the 53 stations were established

sen.j: 一説によると、徳川家康は、華厳経の「入法界品」の善財童子が文殊菩薩の命により53人の師を経て普賢菩薩の所で悟りを開いたと言う一節から、江戸（穢土）から京（普賢菩薩の住まう所）への宿駅を五十三にしたと言われる。
sen.e: According to a theory, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA set the number of stations from Edo (Kanji characters with the same sound, 穢土, has the meaning of unclean land) to Kyou (also has the meaning of land where Fugen Bosatsu(普賢菩薩) lives), based on a chapter from Kegon-kyo Sutra, that Zenzai-doshi(善財童子) of 'Nyuhokkaibon(入法界品)', following the orders of Monju Bosatsu, achieved enlightenment at the place of Fugen Bosatsu, through 53 teachers.

According to one theory, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA set the number of stations from Edo (Kanji characters with the same sound, 穢土, meaning unclean land) to Kyou (which means the land where Fugen Bosatsu(普賢菩薩) lives), based on a chapter from Kegon-kyo Sutra, that Zenzai-doshi(善財童子) of 'Nyuhokkaibon(入法界品)', following the orders of Monju Bosatsu, achieved enlightenment at the place of Fugen Bosatsu, through 53 teachers.

According to one theory, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA set the number of stations from Edo (Kanji characters with the same sound, 穢土, meaning unclean land) to Kyo (which means the land where Fugen Bosatsu (普賢菩薩) lives), based on a chapter from Kegon-kyo Sutra, in which Zenzai-doshi (善財童子) of 'Nyuhokkaibon (入法界品),' following the orders of Monju Bosatsu, achieved enlightenment at the place of Fugen Bosatsu, through 53 teachers.
sen.cmt: kyou→kyo ヘボン式スペース挿入カンマを'の中に

tit.e: The fifty-seven stations of the Tokaido Road
The 57 stations of the Tokaido Road
The 57 stations of the Tokaido Road

sen.j: 東海道の延長線として京街道（大坂街道）の宿場が元和5年（1619年）に設置された。
sen.e: As an extension from Tokaido Road, stations of Kyokaido Road (Osaka Kaido Road) were established in 1619.
As an extension of the Tokaido Road, the stations of the Kyokaido Road (Osaka Kaido Road) were established in 1619.
As an extension of the Tokaido Road, the stations of the Kyokaido Road (Osaka Kaido Road) were established in 1619.

sen.j: 京街道の宿場を含めて東海道五十七次と呼ぶ場合もある。
sen.e: In some cases, stations of Kyokaido Road are included and as a whole are referred to as fifty-seven stations of the Tokaido Road.
In some cases the stations of the Kyokaido Road are included and are collectively referred to as the 57 stations of the Tokaido Road.
In some cases the stations of the Kyokaido Road are included and are collectively referred to as the 57 stations of the Tokaido Road.

sen.j: なお、東海道から京街道に入る場合は三条大橋は通らず髭茶屋追分（大津市追分町）で南西に折れるルート（大津街道）をとるため、大津宿の次は伏見宿となる。
sen.e: Furthermore, when entering Kyokaido Road from Tokaido Road, Sanjo-Ohashi Bridge will not be crossed, and the route that is taken will be to turn south-west at Higechaya-oiwake(髭茶屋追分) (Oiwake-cho, Otsu City), so the station following Otsu-juku Station will be Fushimi-juku Station.

Furthermore, when entering the Kyokaido Road from the Tokaido Road, Sanjo-Ohashi Bridge will not be crossed, and the route that is taken will be to turn southwest at Higechaya-oiwake(髭茶屋追分) (Oiwake-cho, Otsu City), so the station following Otsu-juku Station will be Fushimi-juku Station.

Furthermore, when entering the Kyokaido Road from the Tokaido Road, Sanjo-Ohashi Bridge will not be crossed, and the route taken will turn southwest at Higechaya-oiwake (髭茶屋追分) (Oiwake-cho, Otsu City), so the station following Otsu-juku Station will be Fushimi-juku Station.
sen.cmt: スペース挿入スペース削除

sen.j: 令制国により分類する。

These will be categorized according to their respective provinces.

The first number is based on the country.

The second number is a serial number, starting with Shinagawa-juku Station.
